results.title: Alice in blunderland
results.creator_credit: W M. Moloney and Road Safety Council of New South Wales
results.brief_description: Road safety film made in Sydney using a parallel with the Alice in Wonderland fairytale to discuss issues of pedestrian and driver safety. Focusses on Alice who is more intent on her shopping than on paying attention to the traffic. She meets up with her boyfriend, “The Mad Hatter” and they go for a drive in the country and demonstrate the dangers of admiring the scenery instead of the road. Gives statistics comparing road deaths in NSW with WWII casualties. Features flashback footage of Sydney in 1908.

results.title: Alaska: our pioneer heritage...
results.creator_credit: Don Horter and Pan American World Airways
results.brief_description: Discusses industries and the pattern of life in Alaska. The aeroplane has played an important part in the development of this rugged and sparsely-populated country by carrying supplies and goods from city to city and enabling posts in the outback to be established. Fishing is the largest industry, but lumbering and gold mining are important. Eskimos are employed in selling furs and artistic ornaments to tourists. Many visitors come to the country to hunt big game, fish and observe the beauties of snow and ice.

results.title: Air Conditioned Comfort
results.brief_description: A coarse, insensitive family drives through the National Parks in a luxurious camper, oblivious to the natural beauty around them. The family’s only concern is in looking for real estate, finding the next burger stand and locating the next rest stop. For them the forest is just a place to toss gum wrappers. At the end of the day’s travel, as they are parked in their camper, the family suddenly finds the tables turned in a surprising climax

results.title: Air all around us
results.brief_description: This film is designed to implement the study of air by developing the following concepts: air is all around us; air is a substance, ie it occupies space, and can be weighed; air exerts pressure from all sides; air expands when it is heated and contracts when it is cooled; air can be compressed.

results.title: AIDAB: Australia's aid program making a difference
results.creator_credit: Jane Moore and University of Canberra
results.brief_description: The Australian International Development Assistance Bureau (AIDAB) is the Australian Government overseas aid agency. Most Australians are aware of the government’s role in international relief efforts. However this is just a small part of the aid program. Most of the program is directed towards long-term sustainable development. Sustainable development requires long term strategies to help people improve their own social economic circumstances. This 12 minute video gives an outline of Australia’s official overseas development program. It explains why we have an aid program, where and how it is delivered, what types of assistance we provide and the commercial benefits to Australia.

results.title: Agam And
results.brief_description: Looks at Yaacov Agam, one of the world’s foremost Kinetic artists, who uses modernistic and moveable geometric designs in free moving metals, to depict his concept of life and of Judaism. Also deals with Agam’s unique concept of space and reality. Filmed in Israel, Paris and New York, his paintings and sculptures are shown. Music by Abraham Kaplan.

results.title: After the end
results.creator_credit: Paul Elliot, Michele Bolton and Armageddon Pictures
results.brief_description: A science fiction tale set in the future concerning humanity’s battle for survival in a poisoned nuclear landscape. Cast includes Gary Roche, Ronald Little, Bridget Archibald, Nadine Kempton.
